contributions.title: Add Support for using a pipe rather then a socket
contributions.bodyHTML:
We need to add support for using a pipe to send metrics rather then a socket between processes.

I couldnt find a nice way to reuse the other interface as the model for communication is to different

contributions.title: Expose runtime metrics
contributions.bodyHTML:
Addresses #610

  • Add an IPC metric reporter and collector
    • uses the interprocess crate to get cross platform support
  • Added prometheus endpoint for exposing metrics
  • uses the tokio-metrics crate to expose tokio metric
  • Added the Following metrics
    • granian_number_workers
    • granian_worker_started_total
    • granian_worker_stopped_total
    • granian_requests_processed_total
    • granian_python_call_latency
    • granian_http_responses_total
    • granian_requests_processed_total

Note: I'm not familiar enough with granian to know how to capture all the metrics listed in the issue, so pointers on where to collect those metrics from would be appreciated

Example of prom endpoint

# TYPE granian_total_busy_duration counter
granian_total_busy_duration{worker_id="2"} 0
granian_total_busy_duration{worker_id="1"} 0

# HELP granian_min_busy_duration The minimum amount of time a worker thread was busy
# TYPE granian_min_busy_duration counter
granian_min_busy_duration{worker_id="2"} 0
granian_min_busy_duration{worker_id="1"} 0

# HELP granian_connections_total Total number of connections established by each worker since startup
# TYPE granian_connections_total counter
granian_connections_total{worker_id="2"} 1

# HELP granian_requests_processed_total Total count of HTTP requests processed by each worker since startup
# TYPE granian_requests_processed_total counter
granian_requests_processed_total{method="GET",path="/",worker_id="2"} 3

# HELP granian_http_responses_total Counter of HTTP responses grouped by status code per worker
# TYPE granian_http_responses_total counter
granian_http_responses_total{status_code="2xx",worker_id="2"} 3

# HELP granian_max_busy_duration The maximum amount of time a worker thread was busy
# TYPE granian_max_busy_duration counter
granian_max_busy_duration{worker_id="1"} 0
granian_max_busy_duration{worker_id="2"} 0

# HELP granian_worker_started_total Total number of workers started since the application started
# TYPE granian_worker_started_total counter
granian_worker_started_total 2

# HELP granian_number_workers Current number of active workers in the Granian application
# TYPE granian_number_workers gauge
granian_number_workers 2

# HELP granian_global_queue_depth The number of tasks currently scheduled in the runtime's global queue
# TYPE granian_global_queue_depth gauge
granian_global_queue_depth{worker_id="2"} 0
granian_global_queue_depth{worker_id="1"} 0

# HELP granian_min_park_count The minimum number of times any worker thread parked
# TYPE granian_min_park_count gauge
granian_min_park_count{worker_id="1"} 0
granian_min_park_count{worker_id="2"} 0

# HELP granian_total_park_count The number of times worker threads parked
# TYPE granian_total_park_count gauge
granian_total_park_count{worker_id="1"} 0
granian_total_park_count{worker_id="2"} 0

# HELP granian_max_park_count The number of times worker threads parked
# TYPE granian_max_park_count gauge
granian_max_park_count{worker_id="1"} 0
granian_max_park_count{worker_id="2"} 0

# HELP granian_workers_count The number of worker threads used by the runtime
# TYPE granian_workers_count gauge
granian_workers_count{worker_id="1"} 1
granian_workers_count{worker_id="2"} 1

# HELP granian_python_call_latency Time spent executing Python application code within each worker, measured in seconds
# TYPE granian_python_call_latency summary
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0"} 0.000135375
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0.5"} 0.00014811818813720976
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0.9"} 0.00014811818813720976
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0.95"} 0.00014811818813720976
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0.99"} 0.00014811818813720976
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="0.999"} 0.00014811818813720976
granian_python_call_latency{status="200",worker_id="2",quantile="1"} 0.000391375
granian_python_call_latency_sum{status="200",worker_id="2"} 0.000674875
granian_python_call_latency_count{status="200",worker_id="2"} 3

contributions.title: Skip indexing into a gh action if its not an array
contributions.bodyHTML:
Skip checking a github action step if its not an array as its possibly a templated string.
In gh actions a valid config is ${{ toJSON(steps) }} which breaks the plugins parsing. if we see a string we should just skip those steps
